subject: Data
title: The Dunning-Kruger Effect in Data
description: A quick, practical guide to The Dunning-Kruger Effect in Data.

hook.text: Someone runs their first Excel chart and declares themselves a data analyst. Sound familiar?

buildup.text: The Dunning-Kruger effect: people with little knowledge overestimate their competence; experts doubt themselves.

discovery.text: In data, this is dangerous â€” a little skill makes people confident enough to draw wrong conclusions.

twist.text: The most data-literate people are often the most cautious. They know how easy it is to be fooled by numbers.

climax.text: True data literacy includes knowing the limits of your own understanding.

punchline.text: The first step in data literacy is knowing what you don't know.

quiz.question: How does the Dunning-Kruger effect relate to data literacy?
options: Experts always make the best charts
People with little data knowledge often overestimate their analysis skills
